page.title: 12Braybrooke School
page.content: My school is the third school in Braybrooke.The first one opened in 1836 the second one opened in 1909 and this school opened in 1972.There are four classes and 70 children aged from 4-11. About half of the children come from Arthingworth because the Arthingworth school closed in 1965.We have a foot- ball pitch,a netball pitch and a long jump pit.Our headmaster keeps bees in the school grounds,his name is Mr. Downing.We have a library in each class and a blackboard.We have two globes in the school.We have a T.V.,a video and two radios and a computer.You can have school dinners,sandwiches or you can go home for dinner.Mrs. Johnston teaches the recorder and Mrs. Marshall comes once a week and teaches the violin.In the summer we go on visits to places of interest.Last year we went by train to York. Ben Turner.
